title_en: Kepler and Laws of Planetary Motion

summary.text_en: Kepler discovered three laws of planetary motion! He proved planetary orbits are elliptical not circular, overturning 2000-year belief in circular orbits. Using Tycho's precise observational data, after years of arduous calculations, he revealed mathematical laws of planetary motion. This laid foundation for Newton's universal gravitation.
key_points_en: Proposed three laws of planetary motion

story.text_en: In 1600, 29-year-old Kepler became Tycho's assistant. Tycho had most precise astronomical data then, but refused to share. In 1601 Tycho died, Kepler inherited this data. He spent 8 years studying Mars orbit, tried over 70 circular orbit combinations, all failed. Finally he boldly tried ellipse, data perfectly matched! He excitedly wrote: 'Door of truth finally opened!' This discovery overturned Aristotelian belief that 'celestial motion must be perfect circles'.

fun_facts.text_en: Kepler suffered severe myopia and double vision, but this didn't stop him becoming great astronomer!
He earned living casting horoscopes for nobles, but believed in science not astrology.
His mother accused of witchcraft, he spent 6 years defending her, ultimately saving her.
He obsessed with mathematical harmony, believed God was 'geometer', universe follows mathematical laws.

experiment.description_en: Kepler using Tycho's Mars position data, tried fitting circular orbit, but always 8 arcminutes error (about 1/4 full moon diameter). He knew Tycho's observation precision within 2 arcminutes, so this error was real. After trying various circular combinations failed, he boldly hypothesized elliptical orbit. Using ellipse calculation, all data perfectly matched! This 8 arcminute difference changed astronomy history, proving importance of precise observation.
experiment.why_en: Planets under Sun's gravitational force, orbits actually elliptical. Circle just special case of ellipse (eccentricity 0).

simple_explanation.text_en: Imagine swinging ball on string in circles. If string length constant, ball draws circle. But if you change string length while swinging, ball draws ellipse! Kepler discovered: planets orbit Sun in ellipses, not circles. And planets move faster when near Sun, slower when far. Like sliding down slide - fast downhill, slow uphill!

impact.text_en: Kepler's three laws are milestone in astronomy history! He mathematically described planetary motion precisely, overturning 2000-year belief in 'perfect circular orbits'. His work provided key clues for Newton discovering universal gravitation - Newton derived inverse square law from Kepler's laws. Kepler pioneered tradition of describing natural phenomena with mathematical laws, paradigm of modern scientific method.

influenced_by.contribution_en: Precise observational data was discovery foundation

influence_chain.legacy_text_en: Kepler on Copernican heliocentrism foundation, using Tycho's precise observational data, discovered mathematical laws of planetary motion. Newton derived universal gravitation from Kepler's laws, establishing classical mechanics system. Halley successfully predicted comet return using Kepler's laws. Laplace developed celestial mechanics. Today, all spacecraft orbit designs based on Kepler's laws, still fundamental tool of space age.

quiz.question_en: What shape does Kepler's First Law say planetary orbits are?
quiz.explanation_en: Kepler's First Law states: planets orbit Sun in ellipses, with Sun at one focus of ellipse. This overturned 2000-year belief from ancient Greece that 'celestial motion must be perfect circles'. Kepler through analyzing Tycho's precise observational data, found only elliptical orbits could perfectly explain planets' actual positions. Circle just special case of ellipse (when two foci coincide).
